snippet: The bloc’s last scheduled meeting this year focused on the influx of migrants, with leaders promising only to act on past decisions, and on Britain’s future membership.
abstract: European leaders at final 2015 summit agree to secure control of its borders, currently overwhelmed by refugees from war and poverty, without saying precisely how; continental unity over Russian aggression and Greek financial bailout has been challenged by migrant crisis and Britain's planned referendum on whether to stay in European Union.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and JAMES KANTER

lead_paragraph: The bloc’s last scheduled meeting this year focused on the influx of migrants, with leaders promising only to act on past decisions, and on Britain’s future membership.

headline.main: Leaders at E.U. Summit Vow to ‘Regain Control’ of Borders
headline.print_headline: Leaders at E.U. Meeting Vow to ‘Regain Control’ of the Bloc’s Borders

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
